name: Les Berges du Lac

reviews.text: I came to Les Berges du Lac thinking it is a nice 5-star hotel for international tourists. NOT SO: It is now under Saudi ownership, and they have taken steps to ensure that the hotel is run under Islamic fundamentalist rules. This means for example that there is absolutely no alcohol served anywhere in the hotel, you simply cannot get anything here. Minibar has very expensive bottles of water, thats it - Hotel bar and restaurants - no wine, no champagne, no beer, nothing.
reviews.title: Warning: New owner, now an Islamic rules hotel
Yes, but........
reviews.text: Whilst alcohol is hardly the most important part of travel, I do feel that in an establishment that disguises itself as an international 5-star hotel property we the guests SHOULD HAVE THE CHOICE whether we want a glass of wine for example or not.

Be warned, sadly now each guest who stays in this property is directly supporting islamic intolenrance of other cultures and customs, as this is not the only hotel where Saudi's are trying to do the same. The hotel Concorde chain should also in my opinion CLEARLY STATE that this is an islamic hotel on their website, not to mislead customers.
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved it!!!

likes.liked: — The whole place was so clean, and smelled great!
likes.disliked: — It did not have sandy beach access, but they make up for it in every other possible way!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean, rooms are "neutral" or "typical", not very luxorious but have instead the feel of a standard 3-star European hotel. Service at reception is not very polite or happy, and I had to wait a good 30 minutes & call the hotel 3 times before my hotel car driver showed up at the airport - not apologizing, of course. My room balcony view was not to the lakes, but to other buildings instead, so nothing much to see there.
reviews.title: A scent of roses

likes.disliked: — Service flaws referred to in text

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I paid £140 ($280) for a night here. That is big money for Tunisia (I normally pay around £50 for a 4 star hotel but this one was booked for me by a customer. At least for that money I expected 5 star luxury but I was a bit disapointed. It was close but not quite there. Front desk staff were uninterested and did not smile which got me off to a bad start. They then told me that the spa and leisure facilities were free which was a bit cheeky considering what I was paying for the room. The lobby is luxurious and the rooms very smart - but not outstanding. There were 5 peaches in the room. One was hard, one was mouldy, one was over ripe and only two were good. Picky, yes, but when you pay these prices....... I wouldn't pay that again but it looks like I'm in a minority - the place was full!
reviews.title: Good hotel
Not bad but could be better
reviews.text: Stayed here on business, and thought it was ok.

Great views of the lake, and breakfasts good. Apparently the hotel is not allowed to serve alcohol but it does if you go into the back of the restaurant!!!! the staff in the restaurant are great. Rooms fine, but very very hot to the point of stuffy and uncomfortable. I called downstairs to find out about the aircon and was told to "open your door"!!!! apparently the aircon is only on warm at this time of year. The temperature ,meant I didn't sleep that well.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: There was a bag left in the middle of the lobby while we were there and staff didn't know (or seem to care that much!) about who it belonged to- while there isn't much of a security issue in Tunis, I fouind this a bit worrying/
reviews.title: Nice place, but in the middle of nowhere!

likes.liked: — Free internet, Nice room, new property with potential to be great
likes.disliked: — The location and the lack of the little things that make a long stay easier

reviews.text: Overall a nice hotel but the temperature and attitude of some of the staff lessened my enjoyment!
reviews.title: Good hotel, not the best location

reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful, breakfast wonderful, and the spa was gorgeous. The views of the lake from our room were amazing.
reviews.title: Excellent 5 star hotel

aka: Les Berges Du Lac Hotel Tunis
description: On the shores of the Lake of Tunis, Les Berges du Lac Concorde Hotel enjoys an outstanding location in the heart of the capital's most prestigious business centre, 5 minutes from the Tunis Carthage international airport. The hotel offers a luxuriously furnished, refined and intimate setting, with all the very latest technology. It is the ideal location for meetings and, as soon as you arrive, our dynamic staff is on hand to offer you all the necessary advice and provide you with the very best care for your stay. The concept of a "boutique hotel": the soul of a luxury hotel.
